thread.title: Large explosion rocks aluminum plant in southeast Missouri
thread.title_full: Large explosion rocks aluminum plant in southeast Missouri

title: Large explosion rocks aluminum plant in southeast Missouri
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Aug 4, 2015, 23:06 BST - UK Markets closed Large explosion rocks aluminum plant in southeast Missouri Large explosion at southeast Missouri aluminum plant; some workers have non-critical injuries Associated Press â€“ 2 hours 24 minutes ago Print 
MARSTON, Mo. (AP) -- Emergency crews are on the scene of a massive explosion at a southeast Missouri aluminum plant. 
The explosion and fire around 12:30 p.m. Tuesday sent a large plume of smoke above the Noranda Aluminum plant near the town of Marston in New Madrid County, about 170 miles south of St. Louis. 
Noranda spokesman John Parker says the company has accounted for all employees. He says there were no fatalities or critical injuries. Some people suffered what appeared to be non-critical burns and smoke inhalation. 
Parker called the blast a molten metal explosion in the cast house of the plant, which employs about 900 workers. He says 20 people were working in the area when the blast happened. 
The cause of the explosion is under investigation. 
___ 
This story has been corrected to reflect that plant is 170 miles south of St. Louis, instead of 140 miles.
